TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SamlSubject extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the subject of a SAML security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify the subject of the security token. The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements. The SAML specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement>. A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement> asserts the principal that is the subject of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token. This principal is specified using a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> class.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified name, the domain in which the name resides, and the format the name is in.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the format used to specify a name is extensible, the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.
|Format|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.|

Docs.param: A URI reference that represents the format that the parameter is in. Sets the property.
The domain in which the parameter resides. Sets the property.
The subject name. Sets the property.
An of type that contains URI references that identify the protocols to authenticate the subject. Sets the property.
Additional authentication information that can be used by authentication protocols. Sets the property.
A that provides access to a cryptographic key held by the subject of the security token. Sets the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified name, the domain in which the name resides, the format the name is in, authentication protocols, additional authentication information, and a key identifier.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The format used to specify a name for the `name` parameter is extensible; the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.
|Format|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.|
The set of authentication protocols to specify for the `confirmations` parameter is extensible; however the following table lists the protocols defined by the SAML specification.
|Protocol|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.HolderOfKey%2A>|A URI that specifies that the recipient of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token should use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.SenderVouches%2A>|A URI that specifies that additional information is not available for a recipient of a SAML security token to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.|

Docs.exception:
contains a or member.
-or-
does not contain any members and is or is .
-or-
does not contain any members and or are not .

Docs.value: An of type that contains a set of URI references that identify the protocols that should be used to authenticate the subject.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the set of authentication protocols s extensible, the following table lists the protocols defined by the SAML specification.
|Protocol|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.HolderOfKey%2A>|A URI that specifies that the recipient of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token should use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.SenderVouches%2A>|A URI that specifies that additional information is not available for a recipient of a SAML security token to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.|

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey Crypto { get; set; }
.property instance class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey Crypto
Public Property Crypto As SecurityKey

member this.Crypto : System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the cryptographic key that is used to verify the digital signature that is identified by this SAML subject statement.
Docs.value: A that contains the cryptographic key that is used to verify the digital signature for a SAML security token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> method is called, the cryptographic key specified in the `<ds:KeyInfo>` element of the digital signature for the SAML security token is used to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Crypto%2A> property. This cryptographic key identifies the subject.
The key identifier for the `<ds:KeyInfo>` element is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ExtractClaims%2A> method to get a set of claims associated with the identity of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a key identifier that provides access to a cryptographic key held by the subject of the SAML security token.
Docs.value: A that provides access to a cryptographic key held by the subject of the security token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The key included in the key identifier that is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property is decrypted and set to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Crypto%2A> property when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> method is called.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property corresponds to the `<ds:KeyInfo>` child element of a `<saml:SubjectConfirmation>` element of a SAML assertion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.MakeReadOnly%2A> method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the subject name of a SAML security token.
Docs.value: The subject name of a security token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property specifies the format that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property is in and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property specifies the domain in which the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property resides in.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property corresponds to the `Format` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a URI reference that represents the format that the subject name of a SAML security token is in.
Docs.value: A URI reference that represents the format that the subject name of a SAML security token is in.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property specifies the format that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property is in.
Although the format used to specify a name is extensible, the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.
|Format|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.|
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property corresponds to the `Format` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property specifies the domain in which the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property resides in.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property corresponds to the `NameQualifier` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets additional authentication information that can be used by authentication protocols.
Docs.value: Additional authentication information that can be used by authentication protocols.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.SubjectConfirmationData%2A> property refers to an extensible piece of data that can be customized for a specific authentication protocol.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.SubjectConfirmationData%2A> property corresponds to the `<saml:SubjectConfirmationData>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
